title._content: Florence Julia Bach, American painter and sculptor, 1891-1978

tag.raw: women in fur coat and hat
tag.author: 61489055@N00

description._content: Description: Florence Julia Bach was born in Buffalo, New York. During her busy career she exhibited extensively. She was also an instructor in antique drawing and modeling at the Albright Art School where she had started her own art education. Creator/Photographer: Peter A. Juley & Son Medium: Black and white photographic print Dimensions: 8 in x 10 in Culture: American Persistent URL: http://photography.si.edu/SearchImage.aspx?id=5819 Repository: Smithsonian American Art Museum, Photograph Archives Collection: Peter A. Juley & Son Collection - The Peter A. Juley & Son Collection is comprised of 127,000 black-and-white photographic negatives documenting the works of more than 11,000 American artists. Throughout its long history, from 1896 to 1975, the Juley firm served as the largest and most respected fine arts photography firm in New York. The Juley Collection, acquired by the Smithsonian American Art Museum in 1975, constitutes a unique visual record of American art sometimes providing the only photographic documentation of altered, damaged, or lost works. Included in the collection are over 4,700 photographic portraits of artists. Accession number: J0001274
